sentences.en: A good jazz soloist rephrase parts of the melody while they solo.
sentences.cn: 好的爵士独奏乐手在独奏时会改编部分旋律.

sentences.en: Alice: I must say the soloist.
sentences.cn: 艾丽斯: 我认为是独唱.

sentences.en: By age 14, she was soloist with the London Mozart Players.
sentences.cn: 14岁的时候, 她就是“伦敦莫扎特演奏家”中的主要独奏者.

sentences.en: He thinks the highlight of the performance is the soloist.
sentences.cn: 他认为最精彩的节目是独唱.

sentences.en: The bass soloist was in excellent voice.
sentences.cn: 这个男低音独唱演员这次唱出了高水平.

sentences.en: The orchestra eggs the soloist on with its regular quavers.
sentences.cn: 交响乐团用有规律的八分音符怂恿着独奏者.

sentences.en: The performance of the soloist is up to first | rate international standard.
sentences.cn: 独唱演员的演唱够得上国际一流.
他经常作为独奏者上台演出.

sentences.en: The soloist brought the house down with encore for his impressive voice.
sentences.cn: 这位独唱家以他那感人的歌声博得全场喝彩.

sentences.en: The soloist drags behind the orchestra.
The soloist had never performed in London before.
sentences.cn: 那位独唱者过去从未在伦敦演出过.

sentences.en: The soloist in the violin concert was Menuhin.
sentences.cn: 这首小提琴协奏曲的独奏者是梅纽因。

sentences.en: The soloist in the violin concerto was Menuhin.
sentences.cn: 这首小提琴协奏曲的独奏者是梅纽因.

sentences.en: The tenor soloist is unable to appear tonight because of illness.
sentences.cn: 男高音独唱者因病今晚不能演出.

trans.tran_en: a musician who performs alone or plays an instrument alone
